title: EventFlow: Real-Time Neuromorphic Event-Driven Classification of Two-Phase Boiling Flow Regimes
comment:
19 pages, 6 figures, Under review in Droplet (Manuscript ID:
  DRO-2025-0045.R1)
summary:
Flow boiling is an efficient heat transfer mechanism capable of dissipating
high heat loads with minimal temperature variation, making it an ideal thermal
management method. However, sudden shifts between flow regimes can disrupt
thermal performance and system reliability, highlighting the need for accurate
and low-latency real-time monitoring. Conventional optical imaging methods are
limited by high computational demands and insufficient temporal resolution,
making them inadequate for capturing transient flow behavior. To address this,
we propose a real-time framework based on signals from neuromorphic sensors for
flow regime classification. Neuromorphic sensors detect changes in brightness
at individual pixels, which typically correspond to motion at edges, enabling
fast and efficient detection without full-frame reconstruction, providing
event-based information. We develop five classification models using both
traditional image data and event-based data, demonstrating that models
leveraging event data outperform frame-based approaches due to their
sensitivity to dynamic flow features. Among these models, the event-based long
short-term memory model provides the best balance between accuracy and speed,
achieving 97.6% classification accuracy with a processing time of 0.28 ms. Our
asynchronous processing pipeline supports continuous, low-latency predictions
and delivers stable output through a majority voting mechanisms, enabling
reliable real-time feedback for experimental control and intelligent thermal
management.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种基于神经形态传感器信号的实时流态分类框架，通过事件数据驱动的长短期记忆模型实现了97.6%的分类精度和0.28毫秒的处理时间，为流动沸腾热管理提供了可靠的低延迟监测方案。
AI.motivation: 流动沸腾作为一种高效传热机制，在热管理中具有重要作用，但流态间的突然转换会破坏热性能和系统可靠性，传统光学成像方法因计算需求高和时间分辨率不足而无法捕捉瞬态流动行为，因此需要开发准确且低延迟的实时监测方法。
AI.method: 研究开发了基于神经形态传感器信号的实时分类框架，利用传感器检测单个像素亮度变化来捕获边缘运动，避免了全帧重建的需求，构建了五种分类模型比较传统图像数据和事件数据的性能，其中事件驱动的长短期记忆模型通过异步处理流水线和多数投票机制实现连续低延迟预测。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，基于事件数据的模型在性能上优于基于帧的方法，事件长短期记忆模型在精度和速度之间达到最佳平衡，实现了97.6%的分类精度和0.28毫秒的处理时间，异步处理流水线支持连续低延迟预测并通过多数投票机制提供稳定输出。
AI.conclusion: 该研究证明了神经形态传感器在实时流态监测中的有效性，事件数据对动态流动特征的敏感性使其优于传统方法，所提出的异步处理框架为实验控制和智能热管理提供了可靠的实时反馈，为高效热管理系统的开发开辟了新途径。

title: NeuroFlex: Column-Exact ANN-SNN Co-Execution Accelerator with Cost-Guided Scheduling
summary:
NeuroFlex is a column-level accelerator that co-executes artificial and
spiking neural networks to minimize energy-delay product on sparse edge
workloads with competitive accuracy. The design extends integer-exact QCFS
ANN-SNN conversion from layers to independent columns. It unifies INT8 storage
with on-the-fly spike generation using an offline cost model to assign columns
to ANN or SNN cores and pack work across processing elements with deterministic
runtime. Our cost-guided scheduling algorithm improves throughput by 16-19%
over random mapping and lowers EDP by 57-67% versus a strong ANN-only baseline
across VGG-16, ResNet-34, GoogLeNet, and BERT models. NeuroFlex also delivers
up to 2.5x speedup over LoAS and 2.51x energy reduction over SparTen. These
results indicate that fine-grained and integer-exact hybridization outperforms
single-mode designs on energy and latency without sacrificing accuracy.

AI.tldr: NeuroFlex是一种列级加速器，通过协同执行人工神经网络和脉冲神经网络来最小化稀疏边缘工作负载的能耗延迟积，同时保持竞争性精度。该设计将整数精确的QCFS ANN-SNN转换从层级扩展到独立列级，实现了INT8统一存储和运行时脉冲生成。
AI.motivation: 该研究旨在解决稀疏边缘工作负载中传统ANN-only设计的能效瓶颈问题，寻求在保持精度的同时显著降低能耗延迟积。当前设计缺乏细粒度混合ANN-SNN执行的能力，无法充分利用两种网络模式在不同工作负载下的优势。
AI.method: NeuroFlex采用列级加速架构，将整数精确的QCFS ANN-SNN转换扩展到独立列级，统一INT8存储并实现运行时脉冲生成。通过离线成本模型将列分配到ANN或SNN核心，使用成本引导调度算法在处理器间打包工作负载，确保确定性运行时。
AI.result: 实验结果显示，NeuroFlex的成本引导调度算法相比随机映射提高了16-19%的吞吐量，相比强ANN-only基线在VGG-16、ResNet-34、GoogLeNet和BERT模型上降低了57-67%的能耗延迟积。与LoAS相比实现了2.5倍加速，与SparTen相比减少了2.51倍能耗。
AI.conclusion: 研究表明，细粒度和整数精确的混合ANN-SNN设计在能耗和延迟方面优于单一模式设计，且不牺牲精度。这种列级混合执行方法为边缘计算设备提供了有效的能效优化方案，证明了混合神经网络架构在实际应用中的可行性。
